availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Fitzmaurice (Allen County, Indiana, railroad laborer and soldier.)

body.p: Allen County, Indiana, railroad laborer and soldier. Native of Ireland. Railroad laborer in Allen County, Indiana, in 1860. Served in the 30th Indiana Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 24, 1861, to December 10, 1862. Reported as deserted on December 10, 1862. Indicted for grand larceny in Allen County in December 1863. Reported as a fugitive from justice in Allen County in January 1864. Prisoner in Indiana State Prison North in LaPorte County, Indiana, from February 15, 1864, to September 21, 1867.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Allen County, Fort Wayne, p. 825.
